Male.description: Gila Woodpeckers have a tan nape while Golden-fronted have a yellow-orange nape. In flight the rump patch is barred on Gila, but white on Golden-fronted.

Female.description: Female Gilded Flickers have browner backs and a tan (not yellow-orange) crown and nape.

Male.description: Gilded Flickers have a spotted belly and black chest patch that Golden-fronted Woodpeckers lack. In flight, underwings flash yellow, which is not seen on Golden-fronted.

Male (Red-shafted).description: Northern Flickers have a spotted belly and black chest patch that Golden-fronted Woodpeckers lack. In flight, underwings flash red, which is not seen on Golden-fronted.
